intro: Conradia leucantha, commonly known as the white conradia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy white flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine pubescence. Conradia leucantha is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
